item.title: Mouse Move Command for RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

Ok then, explain this:

MMouse(300, 500, 5, 1);
Will move the mouse anywhere in 295, 499 to 305, 501


The final value would, instead, be 500 and will remain 500.

P.S: Congrats on Mod-ship

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Move Command for RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Yes I know how to use Random, Daniel =.=

{******************************************************************************* procedure MMouse(x, y, rx, ry: integer); By: Benland100 Description: Moves the mouse. *******************************************************************************} //Randomness is just added to the x,y. Might want to change that. procedure MMouse(x, y, rx, ry: integer); var cx, cy: integer; randSpeed: extended; begin randSpeed:= (random(MouseSpeed) / 2.0 + MouseSpeed) / 10.0; if randSpeed = 0.0 then randSpeed := 0.1; getMousePos(cx,cy); x:= x + random(rx); y:= y + random(ry); WindMouse(cx,cy,x,y,9.0,3.0,10.0/randSpeed,15.0/randSpeed,10.0*randSpeed,10.0*randSpeed); end;

Infact it will only add to x and y o_O

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Move Command for RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

If you want your mouse to move every four pixels per 3 seconds, use this procedure in your script: procedure MovePerPixel; var i, c: Integer; begin repeat MoveMouse(x+i, y+c); i:=i+4; c:=c+4; Wait(2997); Until(False); end;
Note to change the values of x, y and the False part to your needs.

[quote=“Nashi, post:2, topic:211500”]MMouse(500, 500, 0, 0);
Will move the mouse to the coordinate 500, 500
MMouse(500, 500, 2, 2);
Will move the mouse anywhere in 498, 498 to 502, 502
MMouse(300, 500, 5, 1);
Will move the mouse anywhere in 295, 499 to 305, 501[/quote]
Wrong. It uses the Random value to determine whether to land when using RX and RY. Since the Random function will never return the exact value entered, it will return one less with a zero. For example: Random(4);
Would return a random value of or between 0-3.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Move Command for RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @Gikon Gikon
item.description:
@Gikon wrote:

[quote=“Nashi, post:2, topic:211500”]You should get SRL, and use MMouse(X, Y, Rx, Ry: Integer);

Rx is how much it can randomly add or take from X
Ry is the same but for Y
EG.
MMouse(500, 500, 0, 0);
Will move the mouse to the coordinate 500, 500
MMouse(500, 500, 2, 2);
Will move the mouse anywhere in 498, 498 to 502, 502
MMouse(300, 500, 5, 1);
Will move the mouse anywhere in 295, 499 to 305, 501[/quote]
Thanks… But
All it does is: Mouse the move 4 pixels every 3 seconds =/

Read full topic
